data.title: not so impressed
data.text: I love Starbucks but this particular location has slow workers so there is always a wait, even when it isn't busy. Also - the last time I went there, the PSL I order was about 3/4 full. The price is already "up there" so it irritates me when the drink is not full. I will continue to go to Starbucks but will probably avoid this one

data.title: Classic coffee in a fantastic location
data.text: Every time we go to the Hillsboro Farmers Market on Saturday mornings we stop in this Starbucks.  Of course they had the advantage of a Killer location, right at the end of downtown Hillsboro by the civic center.

data.title: Usually pretty good
data.text: For the most part I like this Starbucks location because it's close to my house.  The customer service is hit and miss, one day the person that takes my order and greets me is very friendly, other days they seem to care less that I'm there and they hand me my drink, I say "Thank You!" and they say nothing back.  I think its silly that if they don't have one ingredient they think they can't make your drink when it's actually fine but they make its such a chore.

data.title: Spend but good.
data.text: Very good but a bit spend.   Most Starbucks are clean and the staff is very friendly.   I go once in a while as a treat.

data.title: They are extremely quick and friendly
data.text: I always love stopping in at this Starbucks. There is plenty of room and the staff have never messed up my order.

data.title: Coffee
data.text: Extremely friendly staff, able to keep up in a very busy atmosphere, always love Starbucks but not happy about their new rewards program

data.title: The best Starbucks in Hillsboro
data.text: We visit one of the local Starbucks every day. This is a standalone building in a little park like setting. Excellent staff. They just do it a little better here, and it's a nice shady place.

data.title: Good coffee, handy location
data.text: I stopped in for a cup of coffee during the Hillsboro Farmer's Market on a Saturday in Sept and found the shop to be very spacious and inviting. The location was on a bust street corner in downtown Hillsboro, within walking distance from the courthouse, post office and many other businesses in the downtown area. I enjoyed chatting with the staff and even found a specific mug I'd been wanting...stop in for a caffeine jolt, a bite or even to pick up a gift card for someone on your Christmas list. The baristas are quite friendly and ready to serve.

data.title: Hillsboro city office.
data.text: Over priced for coffee. It is more like the gathering place for the underworked overpaid city employees
